result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wayne K. Geigan

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:31 p.m./Rm. 301/State by ADA Kelly Hays.  No appearance by Def.  State asks to modify no contact condition on bond to 'no violent or abusive contact with victim'.  So ordered.  Copy of minutes to go to Sheriff's Dept.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No contact with victim or victims residence.

01:45 PM Defendant Wayne K. Geigan in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wayne K. Geigan appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like to represent himself.  Court goes over waiver of atty rights with def. State is satisfied.  Court will allow def. to proceed with atty.  State is in compliance with victim rights.   Maintain Absolute Sobriety.State gives bail/bond recommendation and request $500 cash bond and gives conditions  Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No contact with victim or victim residence. Def. heard on bond. Court gives 3 factors for setting bond and orders $2,000 Signature bond with conditions   Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription No contact with victim or victim residence. Def. enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty plea.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
